did.head: Descriptive Summary

did.unittitle: Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection, 1992-2006
did.abstract: Steven and Cathi House are Virginia Tech alumnae and award winning architects. Their firm House + House is located in San Francisco, California. This collection includes materials about 15 residential projects located in California, Florida, and Mexico.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection, Ms2006-017, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection was donated to the International Archive of Women in Architecture at the Special Collections by its creators in 2005. An addition to the collection was donated in 2007.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The arrangement and description of the Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection took place in August 2006 and was updated in September 2010. The finding aid was updated to reflect the collection addition in 2007 and 2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Steven and Cathi House are alumnae of the Virginia Tech School of Architecture. In 1982 they opened their own firm, House + House Architects, in San Francisco, California. They have completed a variety of award-winning projects throughout the United States and the Caribbean.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of information about 15 projects, ten in California, four in Mexico, and one in Florida. The material about each project includes construction documents, and some also have related color photographs of the finished project and written project descriptions. The collection is arranged alphabetically by project/client name.. Additional project materials are expected in the future.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by alphabetically by project, and divided by type of material. Sets of construction documents are stored in Map-Cases and rolled drawing boxes.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following items were transferred to the Special Collections Rare Book room:

arrangement.p: The Project Index is a way to organize the various formats of architectural records from the same project. The index is arranged alphabetically by project and contains information, where available, about the location, date, project type, architect, collaborators, photographers, and formats for each project in the collection.
